introduction.p: Apply the constant factor and power rules of differentiation to find the first derivative of each of the following functions. In each case take the derivative with respect to the independent variable suggested by the expression on the right side of the equal sign. Make sure that you assign the proper name to the derivative function. Please note that there is no need to employ either the quotient rule or the product rule to find any of these derivative formulas.

Apply the constant factor and product rules of differentiation to find the first derivative of each of the following functions. Write out the Leibniz notation for the product rule as applied to the given function. In each case take the derivative with respect to the independent variable suggested by the expression on the right side of the equal sign. Make sure that you assign the proper name to the derivative function.

Apply the constant factor and quotient rules of differentiation to find the first derivative of each of the following functions. Write out the Leibniz notation for the quotient rule as applied to the given function. In each case take the derivative with respect to the independent variable suggested by the expression on the right side of the equal sign. Make sure that you assign the proper name to the derivative function.

statement.p: Apply the formula shown for the product of four functions to determine the derivative with respect to x of the function p defined by \fe{p}{x}=x^2e^x\fe{\sin}{x}\fe{\cos}{x}.

introduction.p: Find the first derivative with respect to x for each of the following functions and for each function find the equation of the tangent line at the stated value of x. Make sure that you use appropriate techniques of differentiation.

solution.p: \fe{f}{x}&=\frac{x^3+x^2}{x} &=x^2+x& x\neq0 \fe{\fd{f}}{x}&=2x+1& x\neq0 \fe{f}{5}=30 and \fe{\fd{f}}{5}=11, so the tangent line to f at 5 passes through the point \point{5}{30} and has a slope of 11. The equation of this line is y=11(x-5)+30.

\fe{r}{x}&=3\sqrt[3]{x}e^x &=3x^{\sfrac{1}{3}}e^x \fe{\fd{r}}{x}&=3\left(\frac{1}{3}x^{-\sfrac{2}{3}}e^x+x^{\sfrac{1}{3}}e^x\right) \fe{\fd{r}}{x}&=x^{-\sfrac{2}{3}}e^x+3x^{\sfrac{1}{3}}e^x \fe{\fd{r}}{x}&=\frac{e^x}{\sqrt[3]{x^2}}+3\sqrt[3]{x}e^x \fe{r}{0}=0 and \fe{\fd{r}}{0} is undefined. But \lim_{x\to0^{-}}\fe{\fd{r}}{x}=\infty and \lim_{x\to0^{+}}\fe{\fd{r}}{x}=\infty, so there is a tangent line to f at 0 that is vertical. The equation of this line is x=0.

statement.p: Find the second derivative of y with respect to t if y=4\sqrt{t}\,t^5. Make sure that you use appropriate techniques of differentiation and that you use proper notation on both sides of the equal sign.

sidebyside.p: A function f is shown in . Each question below is in reference to this function. Please note that the numeric endpoints of each interval answer are all integers.

statement.p: Over what intervals is \fd{f} positive and over what intervals is \fd{f} negative?

solution.p: \fd{f} is positive over \ointerval{-\infty}{-8} and \ointerval{2}{\infty}. \fd{f} is negative over \ointerval{-8}{2}.

statement.p: Over what intervals is \fd{f} increasing and over what intervals is \fd{f} decreasing?

solution.p: \fd{f} is increasing over \ointerval{-3}{\infty}. \fd{f} is decreasing over \ointerval{-\infty}{-3}.

statement.p: Over what intervals is \sd{f} positive and over what intervals is \sd{f} negative?

solution.p: This is essentially the same exercise as the previous exercise. \sd{f} is positive over \ointerval{-3}{\infty}. \sd{f} is negative over \ointerval{-\infty}{-3}.

statement.p: The formula for f is \fe{f}{x}=\frac{x^3}{3}+3x^2-16x. Find the formulas for \fd{f} and \sd{f}, and then graph the derivatives and verify your answers to Exercises.

sidebyside.p: A function g is shown in . Each question below is in reference to this function.

statement.p: Where over the interval \cinterval{0}{2\pi} does \fe{\fd{g}}{t}=0? Please note that the t-scale in is \frac{\pi}{12}.

The formula for g is \fe{g}{t}=3\fe{\sin}{t}+3\fe{\sin^2}{t}-5. Find the formula for \fd{g} and use that formula to solve the equation \fe{\fd{g}}{t}=0 over the interval \cinterval{0}{2\pi}. Compare your answers to those found in .

solution.p: \fe{g}{t}&=3\fe{\sin}{t}+3\fe{\sin^2}{t}-5 \fe{g}{t}&=3\fe{\sin}{t}+3\fe{\sin}{t}\cdot\fe{\sin}{t}-5 \fe{\fd{g}}{t}&=3\fe{\cos}{t}+3\left(\lzoo{t}{\fe{\sin}{t}}\cdot\fe{\sin}{t}+\fe{\sin}{t}\cdot\lzoo{t}{\fe{\sin}{t}}\right) \fe{\fd{g}}{t}&=3\fe{\cos}{t}+3\left(\fe{\cos}{t}\cdot\fe{\sin}{t}+\fe{\sin}{t}\cdot\fe{\cos}{t}\right) \fe{\fd{g}}{t}&=3\fe{\cos}{t}+6\fe{\cos}{t}\fe{\sin}{t} \fe{\fd{g}}{t}&=3\fe{\cos}{t}\left(1+2\fe{\sin}{t}\right) So \fe{\fd{g}}{t}=0 where \fe{\cos}{t}=0 and where \fe{\sin}{t}=-\frac{1}{2}. Over \cinterval{0}{2\pi}, \fe{\cos}{t}=0 at t=\frac{\pi}{2} and t=\frac{3\pi}{2}. Over \cinterval{0}{2\pi}, \fe{\sin}{t}=-\frac{1}{2} at t=\frac{7\pi}{6} and t=\frac{11\pi}{6}. This agrees with the answer to .

statement.p: Find the equation of the tangent line to \fd{f} at \pi if \fe{f}{x}=\fe{\sin}{2x}.

hint.p: Begin by applying a double angle identity. Also, make sure that you read the question carefully.

solution.p: \fe{f}{x}&=\fe{\sin}{2x} &=2\fe{\sin}{x}\fe{\cos}{x} \fe{\fd{f}}{x}&=2\left(\lzoo{x}{\fe{\sin}{x}}\cdot\fe{\cos}{x}+\fe{\sin}{x}\cdot\lzoo{x}{\fe{\cos}{x}}\right) &=2\left(\fe{\cos}{x}\cdot\fe{\cos}{x}+\fe{\sin}{x}\cdot-\fe{\sin}{x}\right) &=2\left(\fe{\cos}{x}\cdot\fe{\cos}{x}-\fe{\sin}{x}\cdot\fe{\sin}{x}\right) \fe{\sd{f}}{x}&=2\left(\lzoo{x}{\fe{\cos}{x}}\cdot\fe{\cos}{x}+\fe{\cos}{x}\cdot\lzoo{x}{\fe{\cos}{x}}\right. &\phantom{{}={}}\left.{}-\lzoo{x}{\fe{\sin}{x}}\cdot\fe{\sin}{x}-\fe{\sin}{x}\cdot\lzoo{x}{\fe{\sin}{x}}\right) &=2\left(-\fe{\sin}{x}\cdot\fe{\cos}{x}+\fe{\cos}{x}\cdot-\fe{\sin}{x}\right. &\phantom{{}={}}\left.{}-\fe{\cos}{x}\cdot\fe{\sin}{x}-\fe{\sin}{x}\cdot\fe{\cos}{x}\right) &=2\left(-4\fe{\sin}{x}\fe{\cos}{x}\right) &=-8\fe{\sin}{x}\fe{\cos}{x} \fe{\fd{f}}{\pi}=2, and \fe{\sd{f}}{\pi}=0, so the tangent line to \fd{f} at \pi passes through \point{\pi}{2} and has a slope of 0. The equation of this line is y=2.

introduction.p: In several function and derivative values are given for the functions f and g. The exercises that follow are based upon these two functions.

table.caption: Various values for derivatives of f and g
